image.altText: ACT Magistrate Court

props.synopsis: A man who allegedly "stormed a home" and threatened a mother and son with a taser while demanding prescription drugs and cash will remain in custody.

title.children: Man allegedly 'stormed home' armed with taser and threatened mother and son

image.altText: Chenice Jordan

props.synopsis: Female participation in rugby league across the Canberra region has reached a record high. Despite this, both women's teams in Queanbeyan have been forced to fold mid-season due to a player shortage.

title.children: The footy club with a $600,000 female change room but no women's team

image.altText: A teenage boy holding a softball bat and glove, looking sad.

props.synopsis: It was a schoolyard sport so common it once rivalled cricket as the most popular in Australia. But now grassroots teams are struggling to fill a team sheet.

title.children: Australia were world champs, now teams are scrambling for players

image.altText: A blonde woman in a blue blazer.

props.synopsis: Documents obtained by the ABC under a freedom of information request reveal that a complaint about Leanne Castley was formally lodged on June 25, though it was later withdrawn.

title.children: Complaint lodged then withdrawn against ACT Opposition Leader

image.altText: The sign out of the front of the building and the crest, with an autumnal tree nearby and a blue sky beyond.

props.synopsis: A prisoner has been sentenced to additional jail time, after admitting to biting off part of the ear of another inmate during a fight after a volleyball game.

title.children: Prisoner sentenced after biting off inmate's ear after volleyball game

image.altText: Three in scenery

props.synopsis: In the 41 years since the first Australians summitted Mount Everest, the mountain has been transformed into a tourist attraction. Does the original magic still exist?

title.children: The 'Australian Route' up Mt Everest that may never be repeated

image.altText: Armed forces stand on a hazy city street

props.synopsis: The National Guard was deployed to Chicago streets in 1968. It changed the city forever.

title.children: The National Guard was deployed to Chicago in 1968 — it left the city 'traumatised'

image.altText: An office building with at least seven floors. The building has multi-coloured cladding.

props.synopsis: Four Corners has uncovered allegations of conflicts of interest and pro-industry bias at the country's part-time regulator responsible for Australia's biggest betting companies.

title.children: Gambling regulator's alleged 'cosy relationship' with $50b betting industry

image.altText: Two women in a green outdoor setting looking at the camera. One is wearing a brown blouse and the other a floral top.

props.synopsis: A decades-old psychiatric study is influencing current debates over transgender youth health care. But a new analysis led by a survivor says the findings were deeply harmful and dangerously misleading.

title.children: 'Conversion therapy' survivor speaking out against trans health study

image.altText: A line of hikers wading through snow in poor visibility, dressed up in hiking gear, carrying climbing sticks.

props.synopsis: Local villagers and rescue teams help hikers stranded on Mount Everest after a snowstorm pummels the Himalayas.

title.children: Mount Everest rescue underway as blizzard traps hundreds of trekkers

image.altText: Man in suit points into the distance, stands in front of Australian flag

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is calling for the political temperature to be "turned down" after a Queensland man was charged for allegedly threatening to kill him.

title.children: Alleged death threat signals time to 'turn the temperature down', PM says

image.altText: Snow covered Mount Bogong

props.synopsis: Locals in Victoria's High Country are warning visitors about the unpredictable conditions in the alpine region, after the bodies of two women were discovered near Falls Creek.

title.children: Dead hikers yet to be identified as locals warn of High Country danger

image.altText: A child's hands hold a wooden pencil and rest above a writing book

props.synopsis: Primary school homeschooling registrations in Queensland grew by 110 per cent from 2021 to 2025.

title.children: More Australian families are homeschooling. How can we make sure they do it well?

image.altText: A Facebook post written by Isla Bell's mother with a photo of Isla smiling underneath

props.synopsis: The body of Melbourne woman Isla Bell was so badly damaged that forensic experts were unable to say how she died, a court has been told.

title.children: Forensic pathologist unable to say how 19-year-old Isla Bell died

image.altText: A man dressed in hospital scrubs and a bandanna holds a baby which has its face blurred.

props.synopsis: Perth obstetrician Rhys Bellinge pleads guilty to driving dangerously and recklessly in the days before he crashed his car in Dalkeith and left a 24-year-old woman dead.

title.children: Doctor who killed woman when he crashed into rideshare car back in court

image.altText: Night-vision

props.synopsis: Valerie's disappearance on South Australia's Kangaroo Island unleashed a 529-day hunt. She dodged rescue attempts and traps and had some wondering whether the sausage dog was mocking them and having the time of her life.

title.children: How 'princess' sausage dog Valerie turned feral for 529 days on Kangaroo Island

image.altText: A sinking ship.

props.synopsis: The New Zealand government says it has done "the right thing" in offering a $5.3 million compensation payout to the Samoan government after its navy sunk a ship on a pristine reef off the Pacific island.

title.children: NZ does 'the right thing' in $5.3m payout after sinking navy ship on Samoan reef

image.altText: Charlie Kirk is stood with a microphone in one hand and a red cap in the other.

props.synopsis: The Australian affiliate of late right-wing activist Charlie Kirk's Turning Point USA is moving into South Australia ahead of next year's state election, but some politicians say the group is "out of step with mainstream values".

title.children: Turning Point Australia moves into SA, ahead of state election

image.altText: Mark Latham and Nathalie Matthews together at a dinner table

props.synopsis: Nathalie Matthews, 38, was arrested on Sunday morning after arriving on a flight from Dubai at Sydney Airport.

title.children: Mark Latham's ex-partner granted bail after sharing intimate image charges

image.altText: A grey fighter jet close up in teh sky.

props.synopsis: Department of Defence emails show that a website dedicated to Australia's role in the global F-35 supply chain used by Israel to maintain its fighter jets was removed at the start of the war in Gaza.

title.children: Australia's F-35 fighter jet export details 'quietly' disappeared

image.altText: Kotoni Staggs and Ben Hunt hug as the Broncos celebrate winning the 2025 NRL grand final.

props.synopsis: Defeat in the 2015 decider was so scarring, Hunt eventually felt the need to move away from the club he loves. Ten years later and back in his home colours, he's a 350-game, premiership-winning NRL player.

title.children: 'We got it done for him': NRL's oldest player Ben Hunt finally tastes premiership victory

image.altText: Essendon captain Zach Merrett stands in the race looking up as he waits to leads his team out at Carrara.

props.synopsis: The 2025 AFL trade period officially kicks off as teams begin negotiations over the futures of some of the biggest names in the competition, headlined by Essendon captain Zach Merrett. Follow live.

title.children: Bombers put their foot down in Zach Merrett trade saga

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Brayden Fiorini chooses Bombers over Port, Suns
Charlie Spargo has officially joined North Melbourne
Port Adelaide will not trade Zak Butters this year

image.altText: A young man leans against a wall, arms crossed, next to a painting of Marwan Barghouti raising his hands.

props.synopsis: Despite spending more than 20 years behind bars, Marwan Barghouti is the man most Palestinians would want as their leader.

title.children: Man most Palestinians want as leader has spent years in solitary confinement

image.altText: A man with grey hair and a beard wearing a blue shirt sits in a chair

props.synopsis: There are growing calls for the NT government to ban machetes and crossbows as older residents share horror stories of being targeted in their own homes by armed youths.

title.children: 'Fought back as best I could': Older Territorians share home invasion horror stories

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX has given up earlier gains to be trading flat heading in to the afternoon. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Wall Street edges higher, ASX flat

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Predictive Discovery jumps on merger with Canadian gold miner
Mine disasters drive copper prices higher
Oil price rises on 'modest' production increase

image.altText: A bus sitting at an angle on the side of a road after driving down an embankment

props.synopsis: A V/Line bus carrying a number of passengers plunges down an embankment in Victoria's south east, prompting a high-angle rescue.

title.children: Passengers rescued after V/Line bus crashes down embankment

image.altText: A woman sitting on a bed with her hand on her head with mess around her

props.synopsis: Experts say feeling stuck or frozen when trying to start or complete a task can be the body's response to overwhelm.

title.children: What is task paralysis and how do you overcome it?

image.altText: Major flames burning across bush

props.synopsis: Investigators believe the fire was sparked by a campfire lit on Saturday morning while an active fire ban was in place.

title.children: Moreton Island blaze brought under control after burning thousands of hectares

image.altText: Man looking at for sale sign for apartment.

props.synopsis: The national project to fix housing affordability is off to a slow start but, from deposit schemes and negative gearing to immigration and construction delays, the reasons are complex.

title.children: Australia has a $127,000 housing affordability question

image.altText: A man exposes his backside to Tadej Pogačar.

props.synopsis: A spectator pulled down his pants and bared his bottom towards two-time reigning world cycling champion Tadej Pogačar, while others slapped stickers on his back. But the Slovenian still won the European Championships road race.

title.children: 'This is weird': Bare-arsed spectator can't stop Pogačar

image.altText: A man is tackled in a rugby league match.

props.synopsis: New Kangaroos coach Kevin Walters was part of an era where the green and gold jersey was the highest honour rugby league could offer and ahead of the return of the Ashes it's a legacy he's desperate to pass down to his players.

title.children: After a lost generation, Australia looks to the past on drought-breaking Ashes tour

image.altText: Ali Brigginshaw runs the ball for the Broncos during the NRLW grand final.

props.synopsis: Ali Brigginshaw is named as a Jillaroos co-captain after helping steer the Brisbane Broncos to their fourth NRLW premiership.

title.children: Brigginshaw to lead Jillaroos fresh from Broncos' NRLW win

image.altText: Older woman holds her hands over her chest.

props.synopsis: Australian women having a heart attack are less likely to be promptly diagnosed and treated compared to men, although the gender gap in cardiac care is narrowing.

title.children: Heart attack signs look different in women. It affects the care they receive
